title: How to Get Potassium Nitrate
steps: Find a stump remover product at your local gardening or home improvement store.
Choose a website.
Search for potassium nitrate.
Purchase the product.

title: How to Sprout Quinoa
steps: Place the sprouts in an airtight container.
Keep the sprouts in the refrigerator to prevent spoiling.
Use the quinoa sprouts in a timely manner.

title: How to Propagate Turmeric
steps: Plant your water tumeric in a lake or pool with full sun or light shade.
Consider planting in cups that can be moved inside a greenhouse when temperatures drop.
Plant in rich, well drained soil.
Keep water plentiful.
Don’t feed your turmeric too much!.
Plant seeds in water 2” deep,making sure they float.
Use your grown plants.

title: How to Find Truffles
steps: Clean off dirt with water and a nail brush.
Store your truffles in paper in the refrigerator.
Store your truffles in the freezer long-term.
Sell your truffles to upscale restaurants.

title: How to Drink Turmeric
steps: Blend turmeric, ginger, and coconut water.
Strain the liquid.
Add lemon juice, salt, pepper, and honey to taste.

title: How to Store Fresh Turmeric
steps: Wash the fresh turmeric root.
Use a vegetable peeler to peel off the skin of the turmeric root.
Cut the turmeric root into thin, equally sized slices.
Place the cut turmeric root onto your dehydrator’s drying tray.
Dry the turmeric pieces at 105 °F (41 °C) for 4 hours.
Use a spice grinder to grind the pieces of dried root in batches.
Store your dried turmeric root powder in an airtight container.

title: How to Buy Jicama
steps: Find a store near you that sells jicama.
Choose small to medium size jicama roots.
Look for roots that have smooth, shiny, unblemished skin.
Store the jicama properly.
Prepare the jicama as desired.

title: How to Use Turmeric Powder
steps: Add turmeric powder to rice for golden color and a smoky taste.
Make a turmeric spice rub to add a bold, earthy flavor to meats.
Add color and flavor to vegan staples for a more authentic look and taste.
Dress salads with a bright turmeric, lemon, and ginger dressing.
Make golden milk for a boost of antioxidants in every sip.
Mix up a turmeric detox broth for soups, gravies, and sauces.

title: How to Use Angelica
steps: Candy the stems.
Use angelica to sweeten food.
Eat the roots.
Cook the tips of angelica in marmalade and jam.
Make angelica tea.
Make angelica mouthwash.
Use as a fixative in potpourri.

title: How to Eat Chicory
steps: Wash and slice the roots.
Roast the root for about one hour.
Grind the cooled roots.
Brew ground chicory alone or with ground coffee.

title: How to Eat Turmeric Root
steps: Check international grocery stores for the root.
Look for the root at gourmet and health-conscious grocery stores.
Wrap turmeric root in a paper towel to store it in the refrigerator.
Freeze turmeric root whole.
Blend up turmeric to make turmeric cubes.
Finished.
